alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Houston; Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 01 at 6:01PM CST until January 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .A winter storm will begin to impact the area Monday evening and persist through Tuesday. Freezing rain will develop Monday evening and gradually transition to a wintry mix Tuesday from south to north. Total ice accumulations of a quarter inch, with locally higher amounts, will be possible across portions of northeast Iowa into southeast Minnesota. This wintry mix will then switch over to snow starting late Tuesday afternoon with some accumulations expected. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Ice accumulations of one tenth up to a quarter inch, with locally higher amounts possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches accumulations of one tenth to three tenths of an inch possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There remains the potential for this storm to shift north or south. Travelers are urged to keep up to date with the latest forecasts and statements concerning this potentially hazardous travel situation.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
